item.title: Ashley add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Because there is nothing I would rather do than rummage through bookshops, I went at once to Hastings & Sons Bookshop upon receiving your letter. I have gone to them for years, always finding the one book I wanted - and then three more I hadn't known I wanted." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Ashley add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Emily Jane Brontë
item.description: "If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to be; and if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger." -- Emily Jane Brontë

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Sophocles
item.description: "Fortune is not on the side of the faint-hearted." -- Sophocles

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Well, my dear, take heart. Some day, I will kiss you and you will like it. But not now, so I beg you not to be too impatient." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Thomas Babington Macaulay
item.description: "What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!" -- Thomas Babington Macaulay

item.title: Ashley add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Ashley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Walter Mosley
item.description: "A peasant that reads is a prince in waiting." -- Walter Mosley

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "Laura felt a warmth inside her. It was very small, but it was strong. It was steady, like a tiny light in the dark, and it burned very low but no winds could make it flicker because it would not give up." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Edward Lear
item.description: "And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand, They danced by the light of the moon." -- Edward Lear

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?" -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "I shot that sucker right in the gumpy." Grandma Mazur" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "It was one of those humid days when the atmosphere gets confused. Sitting on the porch, you could feel it: the air wishing it was water." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Ashley add a quote by Beatrix Potter
item.description: "Once upon a time there were four little Rabbits, and their names were--Flopsy, Mopsy, Cottontail, and Peter. " -- Beatrix Potter
